Based on your desire for a distinctive and unvalidated recommendation, I propose the following formulation:

The formulation is Powderkg = 430, wc = 0.45, materials = 0.7/0.3, curing = heat curing.

This formulation pushes the boundaries by increasing the powder content to 430 kg/m³, which can enhance particle packing and the pozzolanic reaction. The lower water-to-cement ratio of 0.45 helps reduce porosity and increase strength. Additionally, the higher ratio of Fly-Ash to GGBFS at 0.7/0.3 can potentially provide a greater contribution to the compressive strength. Finally, the heat curing method can accelerate the geopolymerization process, leading to improved strength development.

Please note that this recommendation has not been previously validated, and laboratory testing will be required to confirm its performance.
